db:abstract.db:para: The QRegion class specifies a clip region for a painter.

db:listitem.db:para: QRegion is part of Painting Classesshared

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QRegion is used with QPainter::setClipRegion() to limit the paint area to what needs to be painted. There is also a QWidget::repaint() function that takes a QRegion parameter. QRegion is the best tool for minimizing the amount of screen area to be updated by a repaint.
This class is not suitable for constructing shapes for rendering, especially as outlines. Use QPainterPath to create paths and shapes for use with QPainter.
QRegion is an implicitly shared class.

db:section.db:title: Creating and Using Regions
db:section.db:para: A region can be created from a rectangle, an ellipse, a polygon or a bitmap. Complex regions may be created by combining simple regions using united(), intersected(), subtracted(), or xored() (exclusive or). You can move a region using translate().
You can test whether a region isEmpty() or if it contains() a QPoint or QRect. The bounding rectangle can be found with boundingRect().
Iteration over the region (with begin(), end(), or ranged-for loops) gives a decomposition of the region into rectangles.

db:section.db:title: QRegion::const_iterator
db:section.db:para: An iterator over the non-overlapping rectangles that make up the region.
The union of all the rectangles is equal to the original region.
QRegion does not offer mutable iterators.

db:section.db:title: QRegion::const_reverse_iterator
db:section.db:para: A reverse iterator over the non-overlapping rectangles that make up the region.
The union of all the rectangles is equal to the original region.
QRegion does not offer mutable iterators.

db:section.db:title: QRegion::QRegion()
db:section.db:para: Constructs an empty region.

db:section.db:title: QRegion::QRegion(const QBitmap &bm)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a region from the bitmap bm.
The resulting region consists of the pixels in bitmap bm that are Qt::color1, as if each pixel was a 1 by 1 rectangle.
This constructor may create complex regions that will slow down painting when used. Note that drawing masked pixmaps can be done much faster using QPixmap::setMask().

db:section.db:title: QRegion::QRegion(const QPolygon &a, Qt::FillRule fillRule = Qt::OddEvenFill)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a polygon region from the point array a with the fill rule specified by fillRule.
If fillRule is Qt::WindingFill, the polygon region is defined using the winding algorithm; if it is Qt::OddEvenFill, the odd-even fill algorithm is used.

db:warning.db:para: This constructor can be used to create complex regions that will slow down painting when used.

db:section.db:title: QRegion::QRegion(int x, int y, int w, int h, QRegion::RegionType t = Rectangle)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a rectangular or elliptic region.
If t is Rectangle, the region is the filled rectangle (x, y, w, h). If t is Ellipse, the region is the filled ellipse with center at (x + w / 2, y + h / 2) and size (w ,h).

db:section.db:title: QRegion::QRegion(const QRect &r, QRegion::RegionType t = Rectangle)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Create a region based on the rectangle r with region type t.
If the rectangle is invalid a null region will be created.

db:section.db:title: QRegion::QRegion(const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new region which is equal to region r.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::QRegion(QRegion &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a new region from region other. After the call, other is null.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_iterator QRegion::begin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const_iterator pointing to the beginning of the range of non-overlapping rectangles that make up the region.
The union of all the rectangles is equal to the original region.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRect QRegion::boundingRect() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the bounding rectangle of this region. An empty region gives a rectangle that is QRect::isNull().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_iterator QRegion::cbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Same as begin().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_iterator QRegion::cend() const
db:section.db:para: Same as end().

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::contains(const QPoint &p) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the region contains the point p; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::contains(const QRect &r) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the region overlaps the rectangle r; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_reverse_iterator QRegion::crbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Same as rbegin().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_reverse_iterator QRegion::crend() const
db:section.db:para: Same as rend().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_iterator QRegion::end() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const_iterator pointing to one past the end of non-overlapping rectangles that make up the region.
The union of all the rectangles is equal to the original region.

db:section.db:title: [static, since 6.0] QRegion QRegion::fromHRGN(HRGN hrgn)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QRegion that is equivalent to the given hrgn.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::intersected(const QRect &rect) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a region which is the intersection of this region and the given rect.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::intersected(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a region which is the intersection of this region and r.
The figure shows the intersection of two elliptical regions.

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::intersects(const QRect &rect) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this region intersects with rect, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::intersects(const QRegion &region) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this region intersects with region, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the region is empty; otherwise returns false. An empty region is a region that contains no points.
Example:

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the region is empty; otherwise returns false. An empty region is a region that contains no points. This function is the same as isEmpty

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_reverse_iterator QRegion::rbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the beginning of the range of non-overlapping rectangles that make up the region.
The union of all the rectangles is equal to the original region.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QRegion::rectCount() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of rectangles that this region is composed of. Same as end() - begin().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.8] QSpan<const QRect> QRegion::rects() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a span of non-overlapping rectangles that make up the region. The span remains valid until the next call of a mutating (non-const) method on this region.
The union of all the rectangles is equal to the original region.

db:note.db:para: This functions existed in Qt 5, too, but returned QVector<QRect> instead.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion::const_reverse_iterator QRegion::rend() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to one past the end of the range of non-overlapping rectangles that make up the region.
The union of all the rectangles is equal to the original region.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.8] void QRegion::setRects(QSpan<const QRect> rects)
db:section.db:para: Sets the region using the array of rectangles specified by rects. The rectangles must be optimally Y-X sorted and follow these restrictions:

db:listitem.db:para: All rectangles with a given top coordinate must have the same height.
No two rectangles may abut horizontally (they should be combined into a single wider rectangle in that case).
The rectangles must be sorted in ascending order, with Y as the major sort key and X as the minor sort key.

db:note.db:para: For historical reasons, rects.size() must be less than INT_MAX (see rectCount()).

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::subtracted(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a region which is r subtracted from this region.
The figure shows the result when the ellipse on the right is subtracted from the ellipse on the left (left - right).

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void QRegion::swap(QRegion &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps this region with other. This operation is very fast and never fails.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.0] HRGN QRegion::toHRGN() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a HRGN that is equivalent to the given region.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: void QRegion::translate(int dx, int dy)
db:section.db:para: Translates (moves) the region dx along the X axis and dy along the Y axis.

db:section.db:title: void QRegion::translate(const QPoint &point)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Translates the region point.x() along the x axis and point.y() along the y axis, relative to the current position. Positive values move the region to the right and down.
Translates to the given point.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::translated(int dx, int dy) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the region that is translated dx along the x axis and dy along the y axis, relative to the current position. Positive values move the region to the right and down.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::translated(const QPoint &p) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a copy of the regtion that is translated p.x() along the x axis and p.y() along the y axis, relative to the current position. Positive values move the rectangle to the right and down.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::united(const QRect &rect) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a region which is the union of this region and the given rect.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::united(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a region which is the union of this region and r.
The figure shows the union of two elliptical regions.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::xored(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a region which is the exclusive or (XOR) of this region and r.
The figure shows the exclusive or of two elliptical regions.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QRegion::operator QVariant() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the region as a QVariant

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::operator!=(const QRegion &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this region is different from the other region; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::operator&(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Applies the intersected() function to this region and r. r1&r2 is equivalent to r1.intersected(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::operator&(const QRect &r) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator&=(const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Applies the intersected() function to this region and r and assigns the result to this region. r1&=r2 is equivalent to r1 = r1.intersected(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator&=(const QRect &r)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::operator+(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Applies the united() function to this region and r. r1+r2 is equivalent to r1.united(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::operator+(const QRect &r) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator+=(const QRect &rect)
db:section.db:para: Returns a region that is the union of this region with the specified rect.

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator+=(const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Applies the united() function to this region and r and assigns the result to this region. r1+=r2 is equivalent to r1 = r1.united(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::operator-(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Applies the subtracted() function to this region and r. r1-r2 is equivalent to r1.subtracted(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator-=(const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Applies the subtracted() function to this region and r and assigns the result to this region. r1-=r2 is equivalent to r1 = r1.subtracted(r2).

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QRegion &QRegion::operator=(QRegion &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-assigns other to this QRegion instance.

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator=(const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Assigns r to this region and returns a reference to the region.

db:section.db:title: bool QRegion::operator==(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the region is equal to r; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::operator^(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Applies the xored() function to this region and r. r1^r2 is equivalent to r1.xored(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator^=(const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Applies the xored() function to this region and r and assigns the result to this region. r1^=r2 is equivalent to r1 = r1.xored(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion QRegion::operator|(const QRegion &r) const
db:section.db:para: Applies the united() function to this region and r. r1|r2 is equivalent to r1.united(r2).

db:section.db:title: QRegion &QRegion::operator|=(const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Applies the united() function to this region and r and assigns the result to this region. r1|=r2 is equivalent to r1 = r1.united(r2).

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &s, const QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Writes the region r to the stream s and returns a reference to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &s, QRegion &r)
db:section.db:para: Reads a region from the stream s into r and returns a reference to the stream.
